section.title: Installation
section.para: There are a number of installation options for &name;. The easiest method is to us one of the standalone versions that use an embedded version of Apache Tomcat . The only other requirements to run this version is Java 5.0 or higher and a relational database. However, &name; is developed as a Java web application, so you can use your own application server, such as WebLogic, WebSphere, or Resin, if you already have licenses for one.

section.title: Windows Installation
section.para: If you are running on Windows, a normal Windows installer is provided that installs into the Program Files directory. You need to have Java installed prior to installing &name;. The installer also adds items into the Start Menu and a Windows Service. The Service can be used to start and stop the server, like any other Windows Service. Before running &name;, you should first configure it. There are a number of items that must be setup.

section.title: Non-Windows Installation
section.para: For other platforms, such as Linux and Mac OS X, a gzipped tar file is provided. This archive does not contain any support for init scripts or startup items. The &name; server is distributed as an executable Jar file.

section.title: Web Application Installation
section.para: A version of &name; without Tomcat is available as a zip file or gzipped tar file. This distribution includes only the web application and the administration tool. An application server is required to run the web application. However, only Java Servlets are used, so you do not need any other J2EE technology, like EJB.
Depending on your application server, you will need to pick up the WEB-INF directory from the tar or zip file and place it in the appropriate place.
